title.narrative: SSC maritime sector, Ghana - Phase II

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Maritime affairs aims at improving the framework conditions for the maritime sector, which contributes to favorable prerequisites for free competition and an international maritime level playing field that benefits both Ghana and Denmark by:
-Improving Ghana’s compliance with IMO regulation by building and implementing a quality unit. -Improving Ghana’s the maritime safety in the Port of Tema by ensuring safe and efficient tug boat operations. -Increasing Ghana’s has increased its Maritime Domain Awareness. -Strengthening framework conditions in the Ghanaian maritime sector. -Improving regional cooperation and relations on IMO compliance and Maritime Domain Awareness.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Maritime affairs is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Maritime Authority and Ghana Maritime Authority. Through the project, the Ghanaian ministry will improve Ghana’s compliance with IMO, maritime safety in the Port of Tema, increase maritime domain awareness and ultimately, protect seafarers as well as supporting livelihoods for coastal communities and life below water.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.
